page.content:
Communicating effectively requires the ability to convey thoughts and goals and understand information presented by others. These skills allow adults to communicate with a variety of people, including within academic, workplace, personal, and peer contexts. Adults who struggle with foundational reading skills will often struggle with oral communication as well. 

Strategies to improve oral community and oral literacy skills include: 

  • Using audio books
  • Incorporating debate 
  • Asking learners to explain their thinking out loud to others
  • Assigning and using multi-media presentations 

Pro Tip: Use technology applications as scaffolds
